servlets

Class ProcessDataServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • servlets.ProcessDataServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class ProcessDataServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    Servlet that processes encryption/decryption request sent from main page and displays result
    Version:
    5.0
    Author:
    Michal Szeler
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      protected void processRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
      Method that processes both HTTP GET and POST requests Depending on user input, it encrypts/decrypts data or send an error if some data is missing/incorrect

                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
                       throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                              java.io.IOException
        Method that processes both HTTP GET and POST requests Depending on user input, it encrypts/decrypts data or send an error if some data is missing/incorrect

        resp - HTTP Servlet response
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception thrown if IO-specific error occurs

      • insertRecord

        private void insertRecord(java.sql.Connection connection,
                          java.lang.String operationType,
                          java.lang.String inputText,
                          java.lang.String keyText,
                          java.lang.String outputText)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Method inserts new record into database
        Parameters:
        connection - SQL connection variable to contact with database
        operationType - String representing type performed operation
        inputText - String representing text before processing
        keyText - String representing key used during procedure
        outputText - String representing text after processing
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Exception thrown if data could not be inserted into database
